required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study to Investigate Safety, Tolerability and Distribution of CHF 6333 After One or After Repeated Inhalation in Patients With Cystic Fibrosis (CF) and in Patients With Non Cystic Fibrosis (NCFB) Bronchiectasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib, Randomised, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetics of Inhaled CHF 6333 After Single and Repeated Ascending Doses in Patients Affected by Cystic Fibrosis and Non Cystic Fibrosis Bronchiectasis

brief_summary.textblock:
CHF 6333 is a medicinal product on development for the treatment of cystic fibrosis and non-CF bronchiectasis and undergoing clinical testing. It has not yet been approved by the authorities for the treatment of these diseases.
CHF6333 is an inhaled anti-inflammatory which mechanism of action is based on the inhibition of Human Neutrofil Elastase.
The safety and tolerability of single and repeated ascending doses of inhaled CHF 6333 was previously investigated in healthy subjects: information was gathered on the uptake, distribution and excretion of the medicinal product being tested (pharmacokinetics). In this current clinical trial CHF 6333 will be tested in patients(CF and NCFB) for the first time.
Three dose level will be tested during the first part of the study, as single administration. One repeated dose will be administered in the second part of the study.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Part I: Randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, single-dose escalation, cross-over design in one cohort of CF patients and in one cohort of NCFB patients. Part II: Randomised, double-blind, placebo-controlled, repeated-dose, parallel-group design in one cohort of CF patients and in one cohort of NCFB patients.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Baseline through end of treatment (up to a maximum of 30 days after last study drug intake) ; Part II Baseline through end of treatment (up to a maximum of 30 days after last study drug intake)
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence and severity of adverse events

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Day 1 pre-dose up to 6 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 6 hours post dose
primary_outcome.description: Change in Systolic and Diastolic blood pressure

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Day 1 pre dose up to 8 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 12 hours post dose
Part I: Day 1 pre dose up to 8 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 12 hours post dose
Part I: Day 1 pre dose up to 8 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 12 hours post dose
Part I: Day 1 pre dose up to 8 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 12 hours post dose
Part I: Day 1 pre dose up to 6 hours post dose. Part II: Day 1 and Day 7 pre dose up to 6 hours post dose. Day 2 -6: pre dose up to 2 hours post dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Day 1. Part II Day 1-7
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration curve

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Day 1. Part II Day 1-7
Part I: Day 1. Part II Day 1-7
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach the maximum plasma concentration
Trough drug concentration 24 h post dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part I: Day -1 Day 1. Part II: Day -1 - 7
secondary_outcome.description: Change in neutrophil elastase activity in sputum

arm_group.description: CHF6333 Active (part I - SAD). Once daily inhaled single dose of CHF6333 at each period (three dose level). CHF6333 Active (part II -MD). Once daily inhaled multiple dose of CHF6333 for 7 consecutive days.
Part I (SAD): Single dose of placebo matching CHF6333 at each period Part II (MD): Once daily multiple doses of placebo matching CHF6333 for 7 consecutive days

intervention.description: CHF 6333 - Part I - SAD CHF 6333 - Part II - MD
Placebo - Part I - SAD Placebo Part II - MAD
